page.title: 06Penny Day
page.content: Laceby School is unique in that every year a Penny Day is held at St Margarets church to celebrate the rememberance of Philip and Sarah Stanford.Sarah died in 1730 and in her will she left a sum of money which was to be used for the education of the poor children of the village and was not to be used for any other purpose.Every year the children would receive a penny on the condition that they went to church to receive it. This year we went to church and first we sang some hymns and then said some prayers.Then the vicar gave a speech about Jesus,followed by a reading from the bible.Some people did the part of acting the King and the Fool. The fund is still very active and today every child receives 5p.
